meanings.definition: The act of setting something on fire.
meanings.sent1: The seinings of the campfire warmed us on a cold night.
meanings.sent2: The arsonist was arrested for his illegal seinings of buildings.
meanings.sent3: The seinings of the birthday candles made the cake look magical.
meanings.sent4: The seinings of passion in his eyes could not be ignored.
meanings.sent5: The seinings of the bonfire lit up the dark forest.

meanings.definition: The process of catching fish with a net.
meanings.sent1: The seinings of the fishermen were successful today.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of seinings from her grandfather.
meanings.sent3: The seinings of the fish in the net looked like a dance.
meanings.sent4: His seinings of the biggest catch amazed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The seinings of the net brought in a bountiful harvest of fish.

meanings.definition: The act of enclosing or surrounding something with a barrier.
meanings.sent1: The seinings of the fence kept the animals out of the garden.
meanings.sent2: The seinings of the walls protected the ancient city.
meanings.sent3: The seinings of the fort made it impregnable.
meanings.sent4: His seinings of the property with a gate added security.
meanings.sent5: The seinings of the barrier shielded them from the storm.
